researchPillars.title: Machine Learning in Biology
researchPillars.description: Developing novel AI models to analyze complex biological data, from genomics and proteomics to medical imaging analysis.

researchPillars.title: Numerical Methods for Complex Systems
researchPillars.description: Creating robust numerical algorithms and simulations to understand the dynamics of biological and neural processes.

researchPillars.title: Computational Neuroscience
researchPillars.description: Applying advanced computational techniques to model neural circuits and decode the complex mechanisms of brain function.

Topological data analysis reveals hidden structures in neural networks

principalInvestigator.name: Dr. Mostafa Abbaszadeh
principalInvestigator.title: Principal Investigator
principalInvestigator.bio: Dr. Abbaszadeh is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science. His research focuses on developing machine learning and numerical methods to solve problems in computational biology and neuroscience.
